definitions.definition: To prepare oneself; to apply one's skill or energies (to some object); to betake.
To clothe or array; to dress.
To direct, as words (to anyone or anything); to make, as a speech, petition, etc. (to any audience).
definitions.example: He addressed some portions of his remarks to his supporters, some to his opponents.

definitions.definition: To direct speech to; to make a communication to, whether spoken or written; to apply to by words, as by a speech, petition, etc., to speak to.
To direct in writing, as a letter; to superscribe, or to direct and transmit.
To make suit to as a lover; to court; to woo.
To consign or entrust to the care of another, as agent or factor.
definitions.example: The ship was addressed to a merchant in Baltimore.

definitions.definition: To address oneself to; to prepare oneself for; to apply oneself to; to direct one's speech or discourse to.
To direct attention towards a problem or obstacle, in an attempt to resolve it.
To refer to a location in computer memory.
To get ready to hit (the ball on the tee).
A process of putting a person's name and address on an item of mail
Any of several methods of locating and accessing information within storage
A mode, manner, or form of direct one's speech to an audience.
